p: Even so, the results obtained here are opposite to those reported by Muthusamy et al. [ 16] with P. amarus, who observed phyllanthin lignan at very low concentrations (0.02–0.25 µg/g callus). These authors observed an increase in the concentration of phyllanthin in the calli in vitro with the addition of 30 µM of the amino acid phenylalanine. Elfahmi et al. [ 22] observed the production of the lignans urinatetralin and cubebin dimethyl ether in cell suspension cultures of P. niruri, not conventionally observed in plants, and the addition of 0.5 mM of ferulic acid or caffeic acid as precursors was beneficial to concentrate these compounds in the cells.
